response.answer_text: 2x - 5 = 5 -2x (Original Equation) 2x = 10 - 2x(Added 5 on both sides to isolate the variable) 4x = 10(Added 2x on both sides to be able to solve the equation) x = 10/4 (Isolated the Variable) x = 5/2 (Remember to simply) Answer in the Box

Okay… I'll teach it in a simpler manner. Your equation says:- 2x-5=5–2x First, bring the numbers with ‘x’ together. Like this:- 2x+2x=5+5 (Don't make mistakes while changing the sign) 4x =10 x=10/4 x=5/2 x=2.5 (you may keep it in the decimal form or in the fraction form). Value of x is 2.5
